In which of the following circumstances, a Government would be said to be in debt?
  1. Its Primary Deficit is more than the Fiscal Deficit
  2. It spends more on revenue expenditure in comparison to revenue receipts
  3. It spends less in capital expenditure in comparison to capital receipts
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: All expenditure on revenue account should ideally be met from receipts on revenue account. Ideally revenue deficit should be zero, else the government will be in debt. The primary deficit is fiscal deficit minus interest payments the government makes on its earlier borrowings
